text: They always packed three oxen together. A lion wanted to devour them, but the three oxen were together, so he could not, for fighting them all at once was a disadvantage. Then he cunningly turned to anger them with perverse words, and separated them from one another. And so, no longer united, he devoured them quietly, one by one. In union is strength.
title: El león y los tres bueyes
author: nan Esopo
